34 // Class definitions
36 
37 enum class ProcessState {
38  kUninitialized = 0, // Created, but not running
39  kRemoved, // Removed from the process list, but not destroyed, e.g. if running process is parented to another process
40  kRunning, // Living processes
41  kPaused, // Initialized, but paused
42  // Dead processes
43  kSucceeded, // Completed successfully
44  kFailed, // Failed to complete
45  kAborted // Aborted, may not have started
46 };
47 
48 
49 
52 class Process: public rev::Object, public Identifiable {
53 public:
54  //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
58 
59  //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
62  Process(ProcessQueue* queue);
63  Process(SortingLayer* sortLayer, ProcessQueue* queue);
64  virtual ~Process();
66 
67  //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
70 
72  const SortingLayer& getSortingLayer() const;
73  void setSortingLayer(SortingLayer* layer) { m_sortingLayer = layer; }
74 
76  ProcessState getState(void) const { return m_state.load(); }
77  void setState(const ProcessState& state) { m_state.store(state); }
78 
80  bool isAlive(void) const {
81  ProcessState state = getState();
82  return (state == ProcessState::kRunning || state == ProcessState::kPaused);
83  }
84  bool isDead(void) const {
85  ProcessState state = getState();
86  return (state == ProcessState::kSucceeded || state == ProcessState::kFailed || state == ProcessState::kAborted);
87  }
88  bool isRemoved(void) const { return (m_state.load() == ProcessState::kRemoved); }
89  bool isPaused(void) const { return m_state.load() == ProcessState::kPaused; }
90  bool isAborted(void) const { return m_state.load() == ProcessState::kAborted; }
91 
92  template<typename T>
93  T* as() {
94  static_assert(std::is_base_of_v<Process, T>, "Error, can only convert to a process type");
95  return dynamic_cast<T*>(this);
96  }
97 
99 
100  //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
103 
105  virtual void onInit() { m_state.store(ProcessState::kRunning); }
106  virtual void onUpdate(double deltaSec) = 0;
107  virtual void onFixedUpdate(double deltaSec) { Q_UNUSED(deltaSec); }
108  virtual void onLateUpdate(double deltaSec) = 0;
109  virtual void onSuccess() { }
110  virtual void onFail() { }
111  virtual void onAbort(){}
112 
115  virtual bool runProcess(double deltaSec);
116 
119  virtual bool runFixed(double deltaSec);
120 
122  inline void succeed(void);
123  inline void fail(void);
124  inline void abort(void);
125 
127  inline void pause(void);
128  inline void unPause(void);
129 
130  // child functions
131  inline void attachChild(StrongProcessPtr pChild);
132  StrongProcessPtr removeChild(void); // releases ownership of the child
133  StrongProcessPtr peekChild(void) { return m_child; } // doesn't release ownership of the child
134 
136 
137  //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
140 
142  virtual const char* className() const { return "Process"; }
143 
145  virtual const char* namespaceName() const { return "rev::Process"; }
147 
148 
149 protected:
150  friend class ProcessQueue;
151  friend class ProcessManager;
152 
153  //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

158  bool checkFinished();

161  // REMOVED, should already be handled with mutex lock
162  //void logMessage(const QString& message, LogLevel logLevel = LogLevel::Info);
163 
165

169 
171  std::atomic<ProcessState> m_state;
172 
174  SortingLayer* m_sortingLayer;

177  StrongProcessPtr m_child;

180  ProcessQueue* m_processQueue;

184 
186 // Inline Functions
188 inline void Process::succeed(void)
189 {
190  ProcessState state = getState();
191  assert(state == ProcessState::kRunning || state == ProcessState::kPaused);
192  m_state.store(ProcessState::kSucceeded);
193 }
194 
195 inline void Process::fail(void)
196 {
197  ProcessState state = getState();
198  assert(state == ProcessState::kRunning || state == ProcessState::kPaused);
199  m_state.store(ProcessState::kFailed);
200 }
201 
202 inline void Process::abort(void)
203 {
204  ProcessState state = getState();
205  assert(state == ProcessState::kRunning || state == ProcessState::kPaused || state == ProcessState::kUninitialized);
206  m_state.store(ProcessState::kAborted);
207 }
208 
209 inline void Process::attachChild(StrongProcessPtr child)
210 {
211  if (m_child) {
212  m_child->attachChild(child);
213  }
214  else {
215  m_child = child;
216  }
217 }
218 
219 inline void Process::pause(void)
220 {
221  if (getState() == ProcessState::kRunning) {
222  m_state.store(ProcessState::kPaused);
223  }
224  else {
225 #ifdef DEBUG_MODE
226  logWarning("Attempting to pause a process that isn't running");
227 #endif
228  }
229 }
230 
231 inline void Process::unPause(void)
232 {
233  if (getState() == ProcessState::kPaused) {
234  m_state.store(ProcessState::kRunning);
235  }
236  else {
237 #ifdef DEBUG_MODE
238  logWarning("Attempting to unpause a process that isn't paused");
239 #endif
240  }
241 }
242 
243 
245 } // End namespaces
